intro: Trachycalymma pulchellum, commonly known as the pretty-fruited billygoat pea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive, hairy, yellow flowers. The plant produces small, woody pods that contain several seeds, which are often used in traditional medicine by Indigenous Australians. Trachycalymma pulchellum thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in shrublands and open woodlands.
